long_description: Designed for advanced skiers starting at 80 lbs., the Marker Griffon 90 downhill ski bindings with 90mm brakes steer mid-wide boards down the mountain with complete control. DIN setting adjust from 4 - 13, a range suited to advanced skiers at high speeds. Composite toe and heel cups keep binding weight to a minimum, and a wide footprint offers excellent performance on mid-wide skis. Triple Pivot Elite toes have high energy absorption to prevent prerelease. Lightweight Inter-Pivot heels focus power in the direction of the boot soles and offer superior holding power and energy transfer. Freeride brakes ensure adequate clearance when skiing backward. Stainless-steel antifriction devices allow essential lateral boot movement despite dirty or worn soles or negative sliding friction. 90mm brakes fit most all-mountain wide skis; mounting configuration of the Marker Griffon 90 downhill ski bindings requires a 76mm minimum ski width.
